intro: Hypodiscus nitidus, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Hypodiscus nitidus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight.
